properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are occurring. Blizzard conditions will continue in Gjoa Haven and are expected to improve later this morning when the winds weaken. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T21:59:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-16T13:16:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1095036390.2020
Area: Gjoa Haven
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: ROAD DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR BURNS LAKE (March 16, 2020 - Smithers) The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with Northern Health has issued a Road Dust Advisory for Burns Lake because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation or dust suppression. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise near busy roads until the advisory is lifted. Exposure is particularly a concern for pregnant women, infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-03-17T08:38:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2020-03-16T16:39:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0751742327.2020
Area: Lakes District
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The passage of a cold front has brought strong northwest winds gusting up to 70 km/h to Baker Lake and Arviat. Blizzard or near blizzard conditions will continue today and through most of Monday night. Some blowing snow will persist through the day on Tuesday for both localities. Additionally, blowing snow continues to persist through the rest of the Kivalliq over the next few days with visibilities dropping lower than 1 km at times. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-17T06:22:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-16T14:23:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1457893662.2020
Area: Baker Lake, Arviat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winds gusting upwards of 100 kilometres per hour are occurring in this area. They will gradually abate throughout the day. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T18:59:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-16T14:55:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2751162522.2020
Area: Salluit

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The passage of a cold front brought strong northwest winds and near blizzard conditions to Baker Lake. Blizzard or near blizzard conditions will continue at Baker Lake today and through most of Monday night. Some blowing snow will persist through the day on Tuesday. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for today into tonight. Snow, at times heavy is expected near Lake Superior. Snow will continue today with snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm possible by this evening from Terrace Bay to Wawa. From Wawa to Montreal River, similar snowfall amounts are possible by early Tuesday morning. The highest amounts are expected along the Lake Superior shoreline. Be prepared to adjust your driving with quickly changing travel conditions. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-17T07:11:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-16T15:12:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3586418196.2020
Area: Marathon - Schreiber, Wawa - Pukaskwa Park, Agawa - Lake Superior Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada
